page.title: 11Being a Local Builder
page.content: {James Wickam writes -}My Dad is a local builder. He works on new houses and bungalows, modern extensions and he does renovations so he has to know how to use many different materials. Stone from three tumbled-down cottages was used to rebuild at Tucker's Farm, Gatcombe. He uses bricks, slates and tiles, stone slabs and cement blocks as well as various types of soft and hard woods. The materials have to suit the customer's requirements as well as meeting the Building Regulations. { {His tools include: Hammers, chisels, saws, shovel, string lines and a square, brickhod, pointing trowel, ladders and trestles as well as a concrete mixer. In 1964 a bag of cement cost 7/- (35p) In 1985 a bag of cement costs Â£3.80 .........a rise of 1100%
